intro: Tylophora umbellata, commonly known as the star-shaped vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are clusters of flowers emerging from a single point. Its fruits are follicles that contain seeds with a tuft of silky hairs. Tylophora umbellata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
